Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The player class includes all the important attributes of a player and methods that can directly modify a player's status during the game. This includes a unique player number, current money balance, current loan & interest, chosen career and path, and the current box space that the player is currently occupying.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Player​(int playerNumber)
      This constructor creates a player with a provided playerNumber.
      Player​(int playerNumber, double startingMoney)
      This constructor creates a player with a provided playerNumber and starting money.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player​(int playerNumber)
        This constructor creates a player with a provided playerNumber. The playerNumber is automatically generated and can range from 1-3
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - player number (1-3)

      • Player

        public Player​(int playerNumber,
              double startingMoney)
        This constructor creates a player with a provided playerNumber and starting money. This constructor is only used for -cm (custom money) argument The playerNumber is automatically generated and can range from 1-3 while the starting money is user-specified (this affects all players)
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - player number (1-3)
        startingMoney - user-specified starting money

    • Method Detail

      • addMoneyBalance

        public void addMoneyBalance​(double amount)
        Accesses the player's current money balance and increases it.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to increase.

      • addLoan

        public void addLoan()
        This method adds player loan by $20,000 and interest by $5,000. It also displays a notice on the terminal that a loan has been added. However it does not explicitly state in the display to whom player has been added a loan to. This may need to be improved during phase 2 development.

      • reduceMoneyBalance

        public void reduceMoneyBalance​(double amount)
        Accesses the player's current money balance and reduces it.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amountt to reduce

      • payLoan

        public boolean payLoan()
        This method allows the player to pay off his loan. Upon success, set moneyLoan and moneyInterest to 0 and update the current moneyBalance of the player.
        Returns:
        true or false if player was able to pay off loan

      • setCareer

        public void setCareer​(java.lang.String career)
        This method may be called before the start of the game. It sets a given player's career.
        Parameters:
        career - chosen career

      • setLoan

        public void setLoan​(double amount)
        This method is only for setting loan to each player at the start of the game. Only available with -cl (custom loan) argument.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of loan to set to each players at the start of the game

      • getCareer

        public java.lang.String getCareer()
        Returns the String representation of a player's career. Note that this will change during phase 2 development as the career should not be a String.
        Returns:
        String value of a player' career

      • getMoneyBalance

        public double getMoneyBalance()
        Returns the current money balance of a player.
        Returns:
        current money balance

      • getMoneyLoan

        public double getMoneyLoan()
        Returns the current loan of a player
        Returns:
        current loan

      • getMoneyInterest

        public double getMoneyInterest()
        Returns the loan interest of a player
        Returns:
        current loan interest

      • hasDegree

        public boolean hasDegree()
        Checks if a player has a college degree.
        Returns:
        true if degree is present, false otherwise
